courseStatisticsScreen.title: Statistics
courseStatisticsScreen.subtitle: Access exam statistics
courseStatisticsScreen.enrolledExamDetailInfo: Detailed information on passing the exam

enrolledExamBottomSheet.title: Passed exam
enrolledExamBottomSheet.content: Statistics regarding the total number of exam passes with two types of display:

item1.title: Single
item1.content: statistics for the selected single year.

item2.title: Comparative
item2.content: comparison between the selected year and the two previous years.

enrolledExamDetailBottomSheet.title: Exam passing details
enrolledExamDetailBottomSheet.content: Statistics regarding the number of exam passers divided into three subgroups:

item1.title: 1st year students
item1.content: students who registered for the exam during their first year of attendance.

item2.title: enrolled from the 2nd year onwards
item2.content: students who registered for the exam during their second or subsequent year of attendance.

gradesDetailBottomSheet.title: Details of votes
gradesDetailBottomSheet.content: Statistics regarding the details of exam grades divided into three subgroups:

item1.title: 1st year students
item1.content: students who registered for the exam during their first year of attendance.

item2.title: enrolled in the 2nd year onwards
item2.content: students who registered for the exam during their second year of attendance onwards.

item3.title: enrolled from the 3rd year onwards
item3.content: students who registered for the exam from the third year of attendance onwards.

escRequestScreen.title: European Student Card
escRequestScreen.firstTitle: What is the European Student Card?
escRequestScreen.firstSection: The ESC (European Student Card) is a digital identification that allows university students across Europe to access services and benefits offered by educational institutions and student organizations in a simple and secure way.
escRequestScreen.secondSection: Using the European Student Card offers numerous advantages, including:

secondSectionList.first: Simplified access to services from partner universities across Europe.
secondSectionList.third: Easier participation in international mobility programs, such as Erasmus+.
secondSectionList.fourth: Access to discounts and promotions reserved for students in various European countries.

cardRequest.firstSectionNormalText: To activate your Card for each of your careers, we need
cardRequest.sectionBoldText: authorization to transmit the following data

escRequestScreen.escModalInfo: All card management and revocation settings can be found within the Education Portal

escModalInfo.revokeConfirm: Revoking the authorization to keep your data in the ESC-Router will deactivate this card and any other cards linked to your academic careers, if any
escModalInfo.text: To obtain your European Student Card (ESC), you authorized the transmission of your data through ESC_router. You can revoke this authorization at any time.
escModalInfo.title: ESC Data Settings

europeanCardScreen.title: THE EUROPEAN STUDENT CARD

0.content: You can customize what you see and make your agenda more organized by choosing the courses to view, the colors and the icons.
0.title: What has changed?

1.content: You will find your way around the Polytechnic more easily thanks to the new system of maps and filters to find what you are looking for.
1.title: What has changed?

2.content: Your comments help us improve: you can send feedback on the new app by opening a ticket that will go directly to the development team.
2.title: How to give feedback?

3.content: To have access to your Polito email, follow the “Configure your email” guide in the new “Guides” section.
3.title: How to configure email?

transcriptMetricsScreen.averageLabel: Average grade for admission to the Final Examination

finalAverageLabelDescription.description: It is the average grade, weighted according to the credits relating to each exam with a grade*, adjusted for the {{-excludedCreditsNumber}} worst credits
finalAverageLabelDescription.formula:
(sum (grade * credits) / sum of credits) * (110/30) ,
excluding the {{-excludedCreditsNumber}} worst credits

transcriptMetricsScreen.laude: *Honours does not count toward the calculation

masterAdmissionAverageLabelDescription.description:
It is the average grade, weighted according to the credits relating to each exam with grade*, adjusted for the worst n credits
(To find out more about n, refer to the Student Guide)
masterAdmissionAverageLabelDescription.formula:
sum (grade * credits) / sum of credits
(excluding the n worst credits)

transcriptMetricsScreen.NBDescription:
These definitions are indicative. To find out more, refer to the Student Guide.
Only graded exams are considered in all average grade above.
transcriptMetricsScreen.pointModal:
The total of the Exam on-time points earned. This value can never exceed the maximum allowed by the degree program.
To find out more, refer to the Student Guide.
transcriptMetricsScreen.title: Career

weightedAverageLabelDescription.description: This is the average, weighted according to the credits relating to each exam with a grade*

weightedAverageDescription.description: It is the average grade, weighted according to the credits relating to each exam with a grade*, expressed in thirtieths.
